intro: Actinolepis multicaulis, commonly known as the many-stemmed beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Actinolepis multicaulis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
